page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Herne Bay did not come into being as a town until the early 19th Century although there was settlement in the area before recorded history began. There was the {ancient village of {Herne},first recorded as having a chapel in 1310,and part of the Hundred of Reculver;also{the small fishing {hamlet}on the shores of Herne parish. The majority of people were farming folk or fishermen and sometimes smugglers too! In 1816,previously marshy lowland between Herne Village and the sea was developed. Streets were arranged in a symmetrical pattern parallel to the sea.A pier built in 1831 brought steam packets to the town and it became a holiday centre;the railway's arrival in 1861 enhanced this trade. In 1881 the towns population was 4,410- in 1981 it was 27,528.
